Gov: Chris Christie vetoed a Democratic proposal to raise the minimum wage from $7.25 to $8.50 an hour, but he offered an alternative plan to phase in a $1 increase over three years and eliminate automatic hikes.
Christie: a Catholic, has expressed his opposition to same-sex marriage based on his beliefs, but he has supported civil unions and ensuring legal protections for same-sex couples.
Christie suggested a referendum on same: sex marriage instead of signing a bill legalizing it, which was criticized by lawmakers who argued that it is a civil rights issue and should not be decided by a popular vote.
State funding for family planning center: 7.5 million in Christie's first budget, leading to the closure of six out of 58 centers, according to State Sen. Loretta Weinberg.
